metadata.title: CVE-2018-5809 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An error within the "LibRaw::parse_exif()" function(internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.9 can beexploited to cause a stack-based buffer overflow and subsequently executearbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5809` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.8-1ubuntu0.2
libraw16 - 0.18.8-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.18.8-1ubuntu0.2').
ufraw package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
darktable package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
rawtherapee package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
